There are many documents right from the SSI (small scale industry) registration that would be required if you plan upon opening a packaged drinking water plant.

Documents require for Packaged Drinking Water Plant

Once you have taken the decision to start the Packaged Drinking Water Plant, you will need to comply with some government authorities. The main documents are:-

  1. SSI Registration
  2. ISI Mark Certificate (BIS Registration)
  3. Pollution control certificate
  4. All required test reports of raw and pure water
  5. Pest control certificate
  6. Chemist-Degree and medical certificate
  7. Microbiologist- degree and medical certificate
  8. Registration of trademark
  9. Medical certificate for workers-4
  10. Document regarding ownership/ Lease of land
  11. Electrical load sanction
  12. MOA( Memorandum of Association) of companies / Partnership deed if applicable
  13. Sanction layout plan
  14. Land (if not in Industrial area should be NA)

FSSAI Licenses for packaged drinking water

  • Basic license: if your turnover is less than Rs.12 lakh per annum
  • State license: if your turnover is more than Rs.12 lakh but less than Rs.20 Crore
  • Central license: if your turnover is more than Rs.20 Crore

Sources of water for packaged drinking water

The sources of water for the packaged drinking water should be from the following:

  • Surface water
  • Civic water supply
  • Underground water
  • Seawater
  • Any other consistent source of water

FSSAI standards

The packaged water plant should follow the given FSSAI standards:

  • The packaged water is required to undergo specific treatment like decantation, filtration, a combination of filtration, aerations, filtration with membrane filter depth filter, cartridge filter, activated carbon filtration, demineralization, re-mineralization, reverse osmosis, etc.
  • The packagers must ensure that the packaged water is fully disinfected by means of chemical agents or physical methods so that the level of microorganisms is below the scientifically accepted level for food safety or its suitability.
  • In the case of Seawater, it must be desalinized before it is subject to the above treatments.
  • Sealed containers of various compositions, forms and capacities should be used which are suitable for direct consumption.
  • Where the water undergoes a process of re-mineralization, the ingredients used in the water will need to conform to food grade and pharma-grade quality.

Microorganisms for packaged drinking water

The drinking water should be free from the following micro-organisms:

  • Escherichia coli
  • Coliform bacteria
  • Fecal Streptococci and Staphylococcus aureus
  • Salmonella Typhi
  • Sulfate Reducing Anaerobes
  • Pseudomonas Aeruginosin
  • Yeast and mold
  • Salmonella and Shigella
  • Vibrio cholera and V. para hemolytic us

Parameters by FSSAI

  • Organoleptic and physical parameters
  • General parameters concerning substances undesirable in excessive amounts

Parameters concerning the following substances:

  • Toxic substance
  • Radioactive residues
  • Pesticide residues

Packaging materials

The type of packaging used for packaged drinking water should follow the given standards:

Materials used ISI standards to comply
Polyethylene IS: 10146
Polyvinylchloride IS: 10151
Poly-alkylene terephthalate (PET and PBT) IS: 12252
Polypropylene IS: 10910

Labeling on the package

Every drinking water package should have the following labeling on it:

  • “PACKAGED DRINKING WATER”
  • “NATURAL MINERAL WATER”
  • “BEST BEFORE”
  • “CRUSH THE BOTTLE AFTER USE”

Labeling provisions

  • No claims concerning medicinal (preventative, alleviative or curative) effects shall be made in respect of the properties of the product covered by the standard Claims of other beneficial effects related to the health of the consumer shall not be made.
  • The name of the locality, hamlet or specified place may not form part of the trade name unless it refers to a packaged water collected at the place designated by that trade name.
  • Use of any state or of any picture which may create confusion in the mind of the public or may mislead the public about the nature, origin, composition, and properties of such waters.

It should be noted that out of 5,842 registered water packaging units, only 1,495 units had both BIS and FSSAI license while 4,347 units only had the BIS certification. It is important to have both the certifications and if you are planning up to open a packaged drinking water plant, make sure you plan it correctly and have all the required documents for a successful business.

Frequently Asked Questions

Where can I obtain FSSAI license for my packaged drinking water plant?
You can obtain FSSAI license from our website: www.fssaifoodlicense.com
How much does it cost to get the license?
The fee for basic license registration starts at just Rs.4,499 only.
What is the process?
Step 1: You need to complete our FSSAI form and email all the required documents.
Step 2: We’ll draft your application and file it with FSSAI office on your behalf
Step 3: We pay the government fee and follow-up with the department for your license
Step 4: Finally, we’ll send you the FSSAI food license via e-mail.
What do you mean by packaged drinking water?
The packaged drinking water could be from any source as long as it has been treated and disinfected, a process that could involve filtration, UV or ozone treatment or reverse osmosis (RO) before it is made fit for consumption.
What is the quantity of water required to produce a liter of packaged drinking water?
As per the International Bottled Water Association, an average of 1.39 liter of water is required to produce a liter of packaged drinking water.
What are the regulatory standards for packaged drinking water in India?
IS: 13428 regulates Packaged Natural Water and IS: 14543 regulates Packaged Drinking Water.
What are the pre-requisites to commencing the production of packaged drinking water?
Before commencing the production of packaged drinking water, there should be official inspection of the plant, tests in an independent lab and official approval with a proper license number should be carried out.
Can a consumer re-use the plastic bottles for storing water?
So to maintain proper hygiene and safety, it is not advised to re-use these plastic bottles as these are not designed for re-use.
Do you recommend consuming packaged water stored in plastic bottles?
Yes, as these are made from Polyethylene Terephthalate and it is completely safe for consumption.
Is it compulsory to have an in-house laboratory?
Yes, it is compulsory to have an in-house laboratory which should be capable of carrying out all the physical, chemical and micro-biological tests (as per the IS: 3025).
Why do I find the difference in taste for packaged drinking water?
Due to different concentrations of minerals in packaged drinking water and due to the geology of the land that they come from gives each bottle water a unique taste.

FSSAI License for Export of Food

India exports a lot of products outside the country and is known widely in the world market for the products that it sends to foreign markets and countries. It is very famous for exporting food items that are produced in the country and is a specialty of a particular region in India. There are many food items that get exported from the country and they all need to be registered and licensed under the FSSAI and health ministry in order for them to be sent out of the country. They need to obtain an FSSAI License for export every type of food item to the country in order to keep track of all the exports. The FSSAI makes sure that the companies obtain a license and provides licenses only to those products which are good for health, high in quality, and would not damage the health of the people outside the country and bring the country to shame. The standards are set in place to protect the best interest of the people and to maintain health decorum outside the country as well.

Export License:

You need to obtain an FSSAI License for Export in order to export food outside the country and you need to get the approval for your food product under the health ministry and from FSSAI. This would prove that the item is not harmful and can be consumed by people without causing damage to their health. To obtain the license, an exporter must do the following:

  • Get a valid import-export code.
  • Register yourself with the Directorate General of Foreign Trade.
  • Get a license from the Central Licensing Authority for exporting food items outside the country.
  • Make sure that the product being exported has shelf life remaining and is packaged well to reach its destination.

It is very easy to apply for the FSSAI License for Export on the website of FSSAI. You need to register your company, obtain an import-export license, obtain a no objection certificate, get the approval for the food item, handle the shipping of the product, and then export the product into the country. You need to register every food item that you intend to export and it should take a long time for the approval and the license to come and therefore, advance planning must be done. You also need to have the required turnover in order to export the products outside the country under the laws stated by the FSSAI.  You are not allowed to export all types of food products but only the ones that have been approved by FSSAI and do not fall under the prohibited category.

No Objection Certificate:

You need to get a NOC before exporting the food items and this is a very important step as it will allow you to further obtain a license from the FSSAI to export your items. Without a NOC, doing further formalities for export of food items will not be possible. You need the following documents to apply for a NOC:

  • Country of Origin Certificate
  • Importer Exporter Code (IEC) issued by the DGFT
  • FSSAI Food Business License
  • Bill of Entry
  • The end-use declaration, a declaration that food is not GM food
  • Besides this, depending on individual import items, other documents may be required.

You need to apply for a NOC, pay the fees for the laboratory testing food the food samples, clarify all the queries that are raised by the Authorised Officer and accompany the inspection team at the time of tasting of the food samples. You need to meet all the requirements from the FSSAI Registration Authority in order to get the NOC, such as follows:

  • The sample should be free from fungal infestation and visible insects.
  • The food item should have a healthy remaining shelf life at the time of clearance.
  • Compliance with the FSS (Packaging & Labelling) Regulations, 2011, and the product-specific labeling requirements.

Once you have cleared all of the requirements, you will be granted a NIC which will help you in attaining the license in order to export the food items outside the country.

Labeling Requirements on Food Exports:

When you are exporting the food into foreign markets, you need to make sure that you have enough information and contents listed on the packaging of each food item in order for them to be acceptable in the foreign markets. The labels and content requirements needed for exporting food items are as follows:

  • Nutritional facts and information.
  • The name of the brand, company, product, etc.
  • The product description and the name of the ingredients used in the product.
  • The volume of contents and net weight.
  • The Labelling Language should be as per FSSAI (Packaging & Labelling) Regulations, 2011 , and the product-specific labeling requirements.
  • The “Best Before” date declaration.
  • Net weight.
  • Declaration of vegetarian and non-vegetarian by symbols.
  • The name and address of exporter in India.
  • Batch number, code number, lot number, and many more.

These food labeling requirements have to be met by the company that is exporting food outside India into the international market in order for the item to be accepted by the international standards and sold in the market outside. The Health Ministry makes sure that the companies that are exporting the food items abide by these rules in order for them to be proudly export the specialty foods of India into foreign markets and not attract any complaints.

Other Documents:

There are many other documents required as well in order to get the license to export food items outside India, such as follows:

  • IE Code License
  • FSSAI License
  • Product Approval Certificate
  • Ministry of Agriculture Permit
  • Ministry of Animal Husbandry permit
  • Narcotics Certificate

Getting the Import-Export code is very important for export as it needed during the export activities as well as in obtaining the certificate and FSSAI License for Export.  You can apply for the registration for the IEC code online and fill the form on their website. The code is issued by DGFT and remains constant throughout the export activities.

Many food items get exported from the country and they all require to be registered and licensed under the FSSAI and health ministry for them to be sent out of the country. They require to obtain an FSSAI License for export all types of food items to the country to keep track of all the exports.
The FSSAI makes sure that the businesses get a license and give licenses only to those products which are suitable for health, high in quality, and will not damage the health of the people outside the country. FSSAI Food License is very easy to obtain with fssaifoodlicense.com. Our expert team will guide you about all the documents required along with all the processing in the licensing.

Any individual or company or business like LLP, Private Limited Company or Partnership firm.
What are the requirements of the FSSAI Export License?
If you are in the export business of food products you require an FSSAI license for that. Export FSSAI license determines that your products are secure, according to standards of FSSAI and can be consumed as it will not cause any harmful effect on your health. Exporters require to follow the following steps to get the FSSAI License for export: First exporters require a valid import and export code. Then exporters have to enroll themselves with the foreign trade Directorate-General. Then you require to get a license for exporting food items from the central licensing authority.

The cost involved in getting FSSAI License for export is Rs.18,000 for a year.

What are the types of FSSAI Food licenses for export?

What will happen if I am doing export without a license?
One has to pay a penalty for not registering for an FSSAI food license for export. The person or the company found guilty of any violation can be punished with imprisonment extending up to 6 months and a fine which may be up to Rs. 5 Lakh.

FSSAI Defending Bromal Proposal in Packaged Water

The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) proposed a new standard for the potential cancer-causing contaminant “bromate” at 10 micrograms per liter in packaged drinking water, considering it to be best international practices. FSSAI said, “This is a draft standard and would be finalized after getting inputs from the stakeholders. The process for setting the standards for food articles is a continuously evolving process.” Bromate is not allowed in packed water in India currently. The proposal was put in public domain for 30 days for feedback. A final order was passed by the food regulator after the receiving comments were over. FSSAI Packaged water is very efficient.


In January 2015, Bhabha Atomic Research Centre scientists picked up samples and published research showing high levels of bromate in 27 percent of the bottled water samples they had picked.

The new standards of water developed by FSSAI License authority recognized that this contaminant may be found in water in some cases and prescribed a limit for bromate in water. While India’s ground realities have to be kept in mind, FSSAI had committed to continually improve and align the national food standards with global standards.” FSSAI Packaged water guide is very efficient.

The World Health Organization (WHO) recommended that the toxic contaminant should ideally not be present at all in drinking water. But, based on the limited capability in 2005 of detecting the contaminant in labs prescribed then, countries such as the US and the European Union (EU) set the bromate standard at 10 micrograms per liter — the level at which it could be then detected in lab samples. In 2014, the US approved testing methods that can now confirm the presence of bromates even at the limit of 0.02 microgram per liter and alternatives to using ozone for disinfecting water. The standards of these countries have not been revised since. The FSSAI in its statement referred to the standards of EU and the US at 1micrograms per liter and Australia at 20 micrograms per liter while stating it had proposed comparable standards for bromate in packaged water.

Food License, you can go with FSSAI Food License .

Bromate contamination can occur during the use of ozone and hypochlorite solutions to disinfect water that is to be packaged. In various countries of the world, alternative methods are used which do not require ozone that leads to bromate formation in some bottles. Ozonation, a cheaper disinfectant method, had been traditionally used for large-scale disinfestations in municipal water supply across EU and the US.

FSSAI updated the list of additives, the draft for which was put in public domain. After this exercise of setting the standards for nearly 11,000 additives was complete, all such issues that arose out of anomalies in vertical standards, such as that of packaged water, were automatically taken care of.  Because the master list of additives finalized  overruled all existing vertical standards of additives and contaminants.” FSSAI Packaged water guidelines is very efficient.

FSSAI  pointed out that bromate was an additive for bread but a contaminant in bottled water. The list of additives with their maximum use levels was finalized by FSSAI, which does not deal with the contaminants.

Overview of the Catering Industry

Types for Catering business license –

To operate in any food establishment like Catering, Food license is necessary to have. Without this license, a penalty will be charged up to Rs 2 lack. General requirements vary but always include inspecting the facility for state compliance. Ensuring staff has the proper training for Food Certification is often mandatory as well.

3) Other licenses or permits –

However, other permits and licenses may be required by local jurisdictions or state agencies. Other licenses like Quality Assurance and Health assurance. It is also very important for the business to obtain because it satisfies the customer mentally when he will hire the services.

Registration Criteria for the Catering business license or Food Service Establishment

The Food Business Operator License is a license which is granted by the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India or FSSAI or that provides the business entity to carry on the activities linked to any stage of processing, manufacturing, packaging, transportation, storage, distribution of food, catering services, import and includes food services, sale of food or food ingredients. FSSAI Food Business License is necessary for a catering business.

According to the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India , it is mandatory for the food business operators whose annual income is up to 12 lakhs to obtain a food registration certificate. The certificate is easily obtained by the State Authority or Municipal Authority or can hire a consultant from FSSAI Food License.

But in some cases, units like Railways, Air, and Airports, Seaports, Defence which are under the central government whose turnover is up to twelve lakhs have to mandatorily go for Central Licensing and such business activities are not covered under this registration certificate criteria.

The following Food Business Operator has to follow a certain process to obtain the FSSAI Catering business license. The application form in FORM A along with the photograph and essential documents is to be submitted with the Registration Authority for the grant of the registration certificate. A fee of Rs. 100 is charged for the certification. The next thing is the inspection part which will be done by the authority. They can either reject or grant the certificate after the inspection. If no message is received or no communication is done by the authority within thirty days, the operator can start his business without waiting for any further communication.

To get the FSSAI food business license, the documents linked to the incorporation of the business should be submitted along with address proof, identity or residential proof of the promoters and details as per the terms of application format. The FSSAI food business license for catering businesses is given by the particular State Government. Hence, the application should be submitted to the regional FSSAI office.

Basic Registration Procedure

  • Every small FBO or start-up shall register itself with the Registering Authority (RA) by submission of an application Form-A, along with the fees as applicable.
  • A Unique Application Reference Number comes to be generated.
  • RA may grant or reject the application – with reasons being specified in writing. Within 7 days of the receipt of the complete application.
  • Once granted, the FBO may commence the business operations.
  • Or, if deemed necessary, the RA may issue a report for inspection. This comes within 7 days. And the date of the inspection must be within 30 days.
  • If in the course of the inspection, the inspecting FSO or agency is content, the FSSAI number will be granted.

Documents Required for catering business / Food Service Establishments

  • Form A or Form B (Form A for Basic FSSAI Registration & Form B for State and Central FSSAI Registration) – complete and signed
  • 2 Passport Sized Photographs
  • PAN Card of the FBO Owner/Proprietor/Partner/Director
  • Proof of Possession of the Premises (Property Papers – if the property is owned, Utility bills (Electricity or water) or Rent Agreement – if the property is on rent
  • Partnership Deed
  • Certificate of Incorporation or Articles of Association (AOA) in case of a company
  • The complete list of food items the unit will be processing
  • The complete FSMS (Food Safety Management System) plan (applicable for FSSAI State or Central Food License only)

There are some requirements which have to fulfill by the catering or the food service establishment –

  1. The operators should ensure that the location of their business should be free from external pollutants.
  2. There should be proper and adequate storage in hygienic conditions.
  3. The cooking methods should ensure fresh food which should be free from any contamination.
  4. Ths stalls or counters should be clean and hygienic.
  5. All the staff handling the food department should also maintain personal hygiene.
  6. Only fresh food should be packed for delivering packaged food.
  7. The containers used for cooking should be free from dust and other articles.

Non-compliance for the catering or food business establishment

All catering businesses that have operations related to food, have to comply with the rules, as introduced and updated by the FSSAI. These are legal obligations that these FBOs must meet. Food Authority conducts inspections and tests at random, of the food articles or the process. At the time of the inspection, the Food Safety Official (FSO) or the agency is approved to examine the business premises, safety, and quality of the process or the food item.

The checklist, FSO identifies a level for the FBO, as either:

  • Compliance (C)
  • Partial compliance (PC)
  • Non-compliance (NC)
  • Not applicable/Not observed (NA)

According to this, a Notice for Improvement may be issued to the FBO. It describes the place or steps where adjustments or changes need to be made. And a time limit is defined for these changes to be completed by. If the FBO fails to incorporate these changes, within the specified time, a Show Cause Notice is given.

Some penalties the business operators have to pay in case of violation of any rule –

  1. The penalty of up to one lack is payable in case of unhygienic or unsanitary processing or manufacturing,
  2. The penalty for carrying unregistered food business is up to Rs. 2 lack.
  3. If the applicant tries to obstruct the food security officer from doing his duty or gives false information, imprisonment up to 3 months and fine up to Rs. 1 lac will be charged as penalty.

What is FSSAI?

Food Safety and Standards Authority of India is established to exercise the powers granted to, and to perform the functions assigned to, it under the Food Safety and Standards Act. It is called the Food Authority. The Food Authority is a body corporate, having perpetual succession and a seal with power to acquire, hold and dispose of property, both movable and immovable, and to contract and shall, by the said name, sue or be sued.

To address the problem of food safety awareness in India, the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India has mandated all the food business operator in the country to register for an FSSAI license . Depending upon the size of the business, FSSAI issues a Central license for medium to large enterprises, a State license for medium enterprises and a Registration for petty food businesses.

What are Petty Food Businesses?

The billing software specializes for bakery these days which also helps in inventory management. There are features to manage the shelf life of the baked items. Therefore, the correct choice for the software must be made wisely.

For any business customers are the key to success. Happy customers become repeat customers and become loyal to you.  so, work to make each customer experience memorable. Satisfied customers bring more customers which increases your popularity as well as the goodwill of the bakery shop. Also, ask for the feedback and product suggestion from the customers. it will help you to know the level of service they want from you. Then make strategies for them.

10. Other Things Needed to Run a Bakery Business

  • Staff uniform : Uniforms helps to deliver the professional look and also adds to the brand value of the bakery shop. It is important that the staff looks clean and hygienic.
  • Online ordering is very popular nowadays so consider these online tie-ups. It is recommended that you should have a good website and tie-ups with the online apps and websites.

The Food Safety and Standards Authority of India issues the Central FSSAI License to the major FBOs in India. It is the first need of those FBOs dealing in the manufacturing, storage, distribution, transportation or retailing of food products.  The FSSAI License registration can be of the State Regulator or Central Regulator depending on the nature of the activity of the business. In this article, we will focus on the requirements and eligibility for getting the Central FSSAI License.

Eligibility for Central FSSAI License

The following FBOs are eligible for getting the Central FSSAI License:

  • Milk Products manufacturing units including milk chilling units. The capacity to process 50,000 liters or more liquid milk per day. Or 2500 MT of milk solid per annum.
  • Edible oil altering units producing oil by the process of solvent extraction. Refineries that includes oil expeller unit processing more than 2 MT per day.
  • Butchery mob which handles more than 50 large animals, 150 small animals or 1000 poultry birds per day.
  • Brawn processing units preparing more than 500 kgs of meat per day or 150 MT per annum.
  • All food managing units including labeling and repacking more than 2 MT per day. It excepts grains, cereals, and pulses mills.
  • manufacturers of proprietary foods
  • All 100% Export Oriented Units
  • importers importing food items including food ingredients and additives for commercial use
  • Storage units other than those having controlled atmosphere and cold environment having a capacity of more than 50,000 MT.

Following FBOs are also eligible for Central FSSAI License-

  • Cold Storages with the capacity of 10,000 MT or more.
  • Controlled Atmosphere + Cold Storage with the capacity of 1,000 MT or more.
  • Wholesalers with the annual turnover of Rs.30 crores or more.
  • Retailers having a turnover of more than Rs.20 crores per annum.
  • Distributors having the turnover of more than Rs.20 crores per annum.
  • Suppliers with the annual turnover of Rs.20 crores or more.
  • Caterers having a turnover of Rs.20 crores per annum or greater.
  • Hotels – Five Star & succeeding.
  • Restaurants having a turnover of more than Rs.20 crores per annum.
  • Transporters with more than 100 vehicles. Or turnover of more than Rs.30 crores per annum.
  • Marketers having the annual turnover of Rs.20 crores or more.
  • Caterers in well-established units under Central Government Agencies like Military, etc.
  • Dealers with authorized premises in Central Government Agencies.
  • Caterers at seaports like Kandla, Mundra, Vishakhapatnam, Kolkata, Cochin, Mumbai, Chennai, JNPT etc.
  • Caterers at the airport like Kolkata, Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Ahmedabad, etc.

Documents Required for Obtaining Central FSSAI License

Following are the Documents Required for Obtaining Central FSSAI License :

  1. Form- B of the FSSAI.
  2. Process layout mentioning the dimensions and operation-wise area allocations.
  3. List of complete Leadership with full address and contact details.
  4. Name and list of equipment along with its registration number, capacity, and power consumption.
  5. A photo ID and address proof by the Government.
  6. List of food category planned for manufacturing.
  7. Authority letter with name and address of a responsible person nominated along with a responsible person.
  8. Analysis report of water you are going to use in the food from a recognized / public health laboratory to confirm the portability.
  9. Proof of ownership of the premises.
  10. Partnership Deed for Proprietorship or MOA & AOA with the Certificate of Incorporation. In the case of Company, three pages are to be uploaded: Certificate of Incorporation, Authorization of food business activity and List of Directors.
  11. Copy of certificate obtained under Coop Act – 1861 / Multi-State Coop Act – 2002 in case of Cooperatives. (If applicable).

Some other documents that are required-

  1. NOC & Copy of License from the manufacturer (Mandatory for Relabellers and Repackers).
  2. Food Safety Management System Plan or Certificate (if any).
  3. Source of milk or procurement plan for milk including the location of milk collection centers in case of milk and milk products processing units. (if applicable).
  4. Source of raw material for meat and meat processing plants. (if applicable).

Technical Difference Between FSSAI Registration and FSSAI License

FSSAI Registration and FSSAI License is compulsory for any FBO dealing in storage, transportation, manufacturing, etc services. In India, Food Safety and Standards Regulations 2011 governs the registration or licensing of the food business. The need of FSSAI Registration and FSSAI License depends upon the size and the nature of your business.

FSSAI Registration

FSSAI Registration is a need for those FBOs which are running a petty food business. The small food business operator here is an entity.

Eligibility  for the FSSAI Registration

  • manufacturing or selling any eatery product by self or through any other petty retailer; or
  • a small hawker, itinerant dealer or temporary stall owner; or
  • an individual distributing food in any religious or social gathering except a caterer; or
  • Other food businesses, for example- a small scale or cottage industries relating small food businesses with the annual turnover of less than Rs. 12 Lakhs and whose:
  1. the capacity of food production (other than dairy products, poultry products) does not exceed 100 kg/ltr. Per day or;
  2. attainment, handling, and collection of milk is up to 500 Litre for a day or;
  3. butchery capacity per day is less than or equal to 2 large animals or 10 small animals or 50 poultry birds.

Procedure for obtaining FSSAI Registration:

  • submission of an application to food and Safety Department ( form A ).
  • The department can submit the application for registration on complete satisfaction or otherwise can reject.
  • The Department will intimate the status of the application within 7 days from the date of submission of the application.
  • The Department shall intimate the decision in writing.
  • The registration certificate by the Department after accepting the application shall have the registration number and the photo of the applicant.
  • At the time of starting the business, the FBO should display the certificate of registration at the location of the business.

FSSAI License

It has Two types of FSSAI License –

  1. State FSSAI License
  2. Central FSSAI License

FSSAI License is taken by the FBO not operating petty businesses i.e, the medium and major FBOs. An FBO needs to obtain the state or the central license according to the size of their business.

A large business of manufacturing, processing, transporting and international trade of food products require Central FSSAI License. Whereas the medium size manufacturer, processors or transporters require FSSAI State License.

Eligibility For FSSAI License:

(a.) FSSAI State License

1. All food processing units including re-labelers and re-packers More than100kg/ltr per day to 2 MT per day.
2. Dairy units including milk chilling units equipped to handle or process 501 liters per day to 50,000 liters per day of milk or more than 2.5 MT of milk solids per annum.
3. Vegetable oil processing units and units producing vegetable oil by the process of solvent extraction and refineries including oil expeller unit Up-to 2 MT and Turnover above 12 lakhs per annum.
4. Slaughtering units
  • Large animals more than 2 and up to 50
  • Small animals more than 10 and up to 50
  • Poultry birds more than 50 and up to 1000
5. Meat processing units 5001m meat per day or 150 MT per annum.
6. Wholesaler Turnover more than 30 Crore.
7. Retailer Turnover more than 20 Crore.
8. Distributer Turnover more than 20 Crore
9. Supplier Turnover more than 20 Crore

(b.) FSSAI Central License

1. All food processing units including re-labelers and re-packers More than 2 MT per day.
2. Dairy units including milk chilling units equipped to handle or process More than 50,000 liters per day of milk or more than 2500 MT of milk solids per annum.
3. Vegetable oil processing units and units producing vegetable oil by the process of solvent extraction and refineries including oil expeller unit More than 2 MT per day.
4. Slaughtering units
  • Large animals more than 50 per day
  • Small animals more than 150 per day
  • Poultry birds more than 1000 per day.
5. Meat processing units More than 5001m meat per day or 150 MT per annum.
6. Wholesaler Turnover more than 30 Crore.
7. Retailer Turnover more than 20 Crore.
8. Distributer Turnover more than 20 Crore
9. Supplier Turnover more than 20 Crore

Procedure to Obtain FSSAI License:

  • To obtain the FSSAI License the FBO shall submit an application to the Department ( Form B ).
